analysis.reasoning: The setup aligns with a high-probability trend reversal. Fundamentally, the company is in a strong growth phase, reporting ~23% YoY revenue growth and 13% profit growth in the recent Q2 update (FY26 context). analysis.fundamental_summary: Metropolis reported robust Q2 results with consolidated revenue up 22.7% YoY to ₹429 Cr and Net Profit up 13.3% to ₹53 Cr. Growth is driven by the 'TruHealth' wellness segment (+25% YoY) and aggressive expansion into Tier-3 cities. Margins are stabilizing around 25% despite expansion costs.
catalysts: Q3 FY26 Earnings anticipation (seasonally strong for diagnostics)
Continued B2C segment expansion driving higher margins
Recent acquisition integration (DAPIC, etc.) boosting regional volume

analysis.reasoning: The BUY signal is validated by a strong fundamental turnaround and technical alignment as of Jan 2026. Honasa Consumer (Mamaearth) has posted a profit of ₹39 Cr in Q2 FY26 (Nov 2025), reversing the ₹18.5 Cr loss from the previous year. The price of ~290 INR reflects a recovery phase with strong support established.
analysis.fundamental_summary: Honasa Consumer has successfully navigated its distribution restructuring (Project Neev), evidenced by the Q2 FY26 turnaround to a Net Profit of ₹39 Cr (vs ₹18 Cr Loss YoY). Revenue grew ~16% YoY to ₹538 Cr. The company's focus categories (Face Wash, Sunscreen) are gaining market share, and the inventory correction drag appears to be over. Promoter stake increase via bulk deal in Dec 2025 is a major positive trigger.
catalysts: Q2 FY26 Earnings Turnaround (Profit vs Loss YoY)
Promoter Insider Buying (Varun Alagh increased stake)

Technical Golden Cross (EMA 50 > EMA 200)
